title: Ticket #6255: Update systemd configuration to start Condor after time sync
description:
We noticed that condormaster would restart on CentOS 7 when it detected a time change at boot (log below). (This is a problem b/c it causes a high rate of failure for job reconnects.)

We were able to delay condor's start until after the system clock was updated by adding a dependency of 'time-sync.target' in condor's systemd service file.

After=syslog.target network-online.target nslcd.service ypbind.service time-sync.target
